pros: Great Company, many opportunities to move around, good benefits.

review_title: Ok place depending where you work
pros: Jobs are available for movement around three company.
cons: Lots of politics, Nepotism, and cronyism.

pros: Job stability, hours, people, location

advice_to_mgmt: Value and promote experienced team members.

review_title: Gaddafi Section Manager at Corporate Accounting.
pros: Pay is good the type of work you do.
cons: One Gaddafi dictates other puppet Section Managers.
advice_to_mgmt: One has too much control over others please take into consideration.

review_title: Leadership is chosen based on nepotism
pros: Working in new york city, you get involved with big projects that you see or hear about in the news
cons: After several years, you will see the ones being promoted are not based on qualification but nepotism and other questionable characteristics.
advice_to_mgmt: Promote those who can do the job instead of those who just speak vaguely and hits all your buzzwords.

pros: Great company with room for growth
cons: work/life balance is almost none

pros:
- Benefits: Despite frequent changes, they are still better than most other companies
- Stability: If you do your work properly and don't step on anyone's toes, you can have a long and growing career
- Salary: The compensation is very fair and you are often paid for extra time you work, although this is more unlikely as you rise in the ranks
- Work/Life balance: Some departments allow flex time and they also offer floating holidays. It's a great offering.
cons: - Sometimes the "old ways" of doing things stifle productivity. It is slowly changing as younger generations move in and older generations retire though.

pros: the training is truly great
cons: They micromanage you to the ground. Big brother is always watching should be their motto. They even bug you about how long you take at the bathroom and god forbid u get sick you can’t call out

review_title: Great pay for an internship and adds experience
pros: Pay depends on number of credits taken in college, starts with $20+/hour. Company is nationally recognized so looks good on a resume
cons: Has to be current and continuing student. Treated as temporary.

review_title: It a secure gig for a student
pros: Flexable company they work with your schedule as an intern so you can take classes in the middle of the day and go back to work make some hours. Nice Pay
cons: Not any really. It would be nice to get paid on friday.

pros: Solid benefits, safety-centric, opportunity to advance, good pay
cons: Can be difficult to change jobs/advance, co-worker conflict

review_title: Great place to work and to learn
pros: Collaborative work environment, team-based, and many opportunities to learn. Tuition remission is a huge plus.
cons: Very difficult to move up, unless you're willing to wait for your turn which can take years. Internal mobility is an issue.
advice_to_mgmt: Let driven, productive high performers move up the ladder.

pros: Good work life balance. A good job to have some side hustles (part time job, open a business, or hobbies)
cons: Recently started Business Cost Optimization (BCO) which in a way to cut cost and add more work/stress to the employee. You need to know someone to

pros: Paycheck, good benefits, nice co workers
cons: The PMO department has some of the most awful Managers. They seems to lack intelligence and are only really there to take notes and contribute nothing. I don't know how these people got their positions, although some are related to former higher ups, so I am sure that's how they got there. We are forced to work with the PMO but they have really not contributed anything to the company except for charging our projects and causing grief. They clock every minute you are in or out of the office. They are note takers and time keepers and get paid a lot of money for it. Completely useless.
advice_to_mgmt: Get rid of the PMO, its a joke!

review_title: If working at quasi government agencies appeals to you.
pros: Job security provided for mediocraty
cons: High performance employees cannot thrive here.
advice_to_mgmt: Not applicable as senior management is the problem. To the CEO: consider recruiting outside of CECONY for band 4 and above.

pros: work-life balance; nothing else qualifies as a pro
cons: No career path, bureaucracy, incompetent leadership

pros: Great pay. Great benefits. Room for progression.
cons: Higher ranked mechanics dictate your day flow.

review_title: Overall its just an average company to stay afloat
pros: Ok benefits and pay, still below the industry trends, but manageable. Combination of good, bad and worse workforce. But for the most part most of the coworkers are helpful and will lead to the right direction
cons: Somehow, there is no room for advancement or growth and since every promotion or opportunities is reserved for the employees who come through the gold program. The gold associate are treated as untouchables and this has created a sense of immortality within some gold managers. Witnessing a gold manager cursing out in presence of the team is a daily occurrence. There is an absence of a strong leadership within the gas business.
advice_to_mgmt: Employees who joined the company without being a part of gold program should be given consideration within new growth opportunities.

pros: Flexible schedule for college students.
cons: Often times have unnecessary meetings.

pros: Lots of nice employees who have been working here a long time.
cons: Extremely bureaucratic. Many in management positions are here a long time and do not know what they are doing. Or they don't care.
